title: IDOR in marketing calendar tool
vulnerability_information:
#INTRODUCTION

##_I used two accounts to search for this vulnerability:_
**Id:** █████ **Email:** ██████
**Id:** ███ **Email:** ███

##_IP used:_
**78.194.169.36**

##_Endpoint URL:_
https://ec.semrush.com/api/v1/ga/user_status/?calendar_id=CALENDAR_ID

#EXPLOITATION

##_Description of Security Issue:_
When a marketing calendar is loaded in the browser, the site sends a request such as this: {F718449}.
This request returns information such as if the owner has connected a google analytic account and the owner's user id associated with the calendar with the id pass in parameter. The problem comes from the fact that it is not verified that the user making the request has the calendar or that the person is invited to consult it.

#RESOLUTION
Check that the user making the request has the calendar or that the person is invited to consult the calendar.

## Impact

##_Exploit scenario for this vulnerability:_

 - A user such as a concurrent service could by bruteforcing the "calendar_id" parameter establish a list of all calendars and the number of unique users who have created calendars. It will also know the number of users who have connected their google analytic account on it. This represents bussiness data.

 - A user who knows someone's user_id (because he was invited to a calendar owned by the victim for example) can by bruteforcing the parameter "calendar_id" establish the number of calendar owned by the victim and the number of calendar being linked to a google analytic account.

activities.message:
Hello, 
Could you please get more details on impact 
At the moment I can’t find this report as valid.

If a person happens to have access to the user_id of another person (for example when a person is invited to see a calendar the guest has access to the user_id of the participants) then he has the possibility of using this data to find the user_id corresponding to the victim and thus know the number of calendars created by it, and among each calendar which are linked to a google analytic account.
Bug's pushed to the appropriate team. We are waiting for the team's response.
Could you please check the fix?
Hi yes I can confirm the fix!

You gave me a first promo code that I used for a semrush account and then I asked you if I could have a second for my second account to test for vulnerabilities like this. You gave me two but I only used one as I already have an account with the first promo code. The promo code is non-cumulative and my account with the first promo code has expired and I can no longer use the one in reserve because it too has to expire.
Would you agree to give me a new one please?

Hi @a_d_a_m! Here's the promo:
██████████
██████████
You have one week to activate it and it will last for 2 weeks. Also, you can activate it (during this week) for multiple accounts for testing IDOR.
Here you can see a brief description of Business plan's features - https://www.semrush.com/prices/#table.
Hi, @a_d_a_m ! Thanks for your patience and for making our service safer! Here’s your 💰bounty!

Hello,
When I use the code I get the following error:
We are sorry, but entered Promo Code can’t be used. Please, contact us via mail@semrush.com so we can help you!
Hi @a_d_a_m! Sorry about the late response. We can see that the promo hasn't activated, hopefully today will solve the issue.
Hello, @a_d_a_m! The reason you get the error is because you can't use the promo code twice on the same account. Please register a new one and use the promo code with it.

Hi!
Thank you for you answer.
Thanks for making our service safer! We will wait for more findings from you!
Are you agree to disclose it please?
